intro: Mesembryanthemum ruedebuschii, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers that open in response to light. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. Its fleshy leaves and drought-resistant properties make it well adapted to arid environments. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in rocky soils.
